Error Monitoring System.description: The overall system responsible for identifying and handling errors.

Error Detection.description: The process of identifying that an error has occurred.

Error Response.description: The actions taken in response to a detected error.

Sensor Input.description: Input data from various sensors or sources.

Data Analysis.description: Analyzing data to identify discrepancies or anomalies.

Error Logging.description: Recording details about the error for later analysis.

Error Recovery.description: Actions taken to restore the system to a functional state.

Sensor Calibration.description: Ensuring the accuracy of sensor readings.

Algorithm Performance.description: The effectiveness of algorithms used in error detection.

Data Quality.description: The accuracy and reliability of the input data.

Log Storage.description: Storing error logs in a database or file system.

System Restart.description: Restarting the system to clear errors.
